item.title: Copy-on-write with KVM
item.description: While KVM/QEMU snapshoting is still a dirty feature (quite slow), I love copy-on-write disc image format of the QEMU. It is actually the best way how to quiclky provision pre-installed systems for testing and development. The idea is easy: Install a base operating system, configure it for your specific purposes.Stop it. You wont use it anymore, only copy-on-write "children". You may start it to do some additional configuration when you forgot something for example.
